API reference¶

rfcde.core¶

Provides the RFCDE class for fitting RFCDE models.

class rfcde.core.RFCDE(n_trees, mtry, node_size, min_loss_delta=0.0, n_basis=15, basis_system='cosine')[source]¶

Object for RFCDE.

Parameters:
  • n_trees (integer) – The number of trees to train.
  • mtry (integer) – The number of variables to evaluate at each split.
  • node_size (integer) – The minimum number of observations in each leaf node.
  • min_loss_delta (float) – The minimum change in loss for a split.
  • n_basis (integer) – The number of basis functions used for split density estimates.
  • basis_system ({'cosine'}) – The basis system for split density estimates.
n_trees¶

integer – The number of trees to train.

mtry¶

integer – The number of variables to evaluate at each split.

node_size¶

integer – The minimum number of observations in each leaf node.

min_loss_delta¶

float – The minimum change in loss for a split.

n_basis¶

integer – The number of basis functions used for split density estimates.

basis_system¶

{‘cosine’} – The basis system for split density estimates.

z_train¶

numpy array/matrix – The training responses. Each value/row corresponds to an observation.

fit_oob¶

boolean – Whether the forest has fit out-of-bag samples.

forest¶

ForestWrapper – Wrapped C++ forest

oob_weights()[source]¶

Calculates out-of-bag weights from forest tree structure.

Returns:A matrix with element [ii, jj] being the out-of-bag weight for training point jj when predicting for training point ii.
Return type:numpy matrix
Raises:ValueError – If the forest was not fit with out-of-bag samples.
predict(x_new, z_grid, bandwidth)[source]¶

Calculate KDE conditional density estimate for new observations.

Parameters:
  • x_new (numpy array/matrix) – The covariates for the new observations. Each row/value corresponds to an observation. Must have the same dimensionality as the training covariates.
  • z_grid (numpy array/matrix) – The grid points at which to estimate the conditional densities.
  • bandwidth (float) – The bandwidth for the kernel density estimates.
Returns:

A matrix of conditional density estimates; each column corresponds to a grid point, each row corresponds to an observation.
Return type:

numpy matrix
train(x_train, z_train, fit_oob=False)[source]¶

Train RFCDE object on training data.

Parameters:
  • x_train (numpy array/matrix) – The training covariates. Each value/row corresponds to an observation.
  • z_train (numpy array/matrix) – The training responses. Each value/row corresponds to an observation.
  • fit_oob (boolean) – Whether to fit out-of-bag observations.
weights(x_new)[source]¶

Calculate weights from forest tree structure.

Parameters:x_test (numpy array) – A new observation.
Returns:The weights of each training point for the new observation.
Return type:numpy array

RFCDE

Random Forests for Conditional Density Estimation
